article: How to Feed a Wild Rabbit
intro: If you see a wild rabbit in your yard, you may want to start feeding it. Before you go outside with a handful of carrots and lettuce, though, it is important for you to know what to

steps.title: Provide the wild rabbits with small amounts of fruit.
steps.subtitle: Wild rabbits will eat small berries, but will also eat other plant parts to balance off the fruit’s high sugar content. If you would like to give fruit to the wild rabbits, consider giving them different types of berries: blueberries, raspberries, strawberries, and blackberries.
sub-points: For raspberries and blackberries, provide the wild rabbits with the fruit as well as the plant stems and leaves.

Bananas and dried fruit are very high in sugar and should be fed only sparingly (even less than the other fruits). Per rabbit, one to two half-inch slices of bananas and two to three pieces of dried fruit would be enough.

Other types of fruit you could feed the wild rabbits include , honeydew melon, and plums (without the pit). However, you may want to stick with the berries, since the rabbits may be more accustomed to eating these in their natural environment.

points.name: Feeding an Orphaned Baby Wild Rabbit
